Instruction: Chill the beef tenderloin in the freezer for about 30 minutes to firm it up for easier chopping.
Finely dice the chilled beef tenderloin.

In a mixing bowl, combine the diced beef tenderloin, egg yolk, Dijon mustard, finely chopped capers, finely chopped cornichons, finely chopped red onion, finely chopped fresh parsley, salt, black pepper, Worcestershire sauce, and Tabasco sauce.
Mix the ingredients together until well combined.
Taste and adjust seasoning if necessary.
Divide the steak tartare mixture into individual servings and shape each portion into a mound on serving plates.
Drizzle a little olive oil over each portion.
Serve the steak tartare immediately, accompanied by toasted bread or crackers.
